column1: One old woman especially loved the smells that drifted out of the bakery window every morning. This was Ma Shange who slept on a bench in the park every night. A few weeks before
column2: a kind person had given her the money to buy herself a cinnamon bun. She had taken the bun back to the park and ate it very slowly
column3: licking her lips and sharing the last crumbs with the birds. After that
column4: although the old woman didn't have enough money to buy breakfast
column5: she longed for the delicious bun again. So
column6: every morning she walked slowly past Mr Shabangu's bakery
column7: sniffing the air and smiling blissfully at the mouth-watering smell. Ma Shange's new habit made the baker very angry. As each day went by
column8: he grew angrier and angrier with her. Finally
column9: one winter morning when he was in an especially bad mood
column10: he stormed out of his bakery and grabbed the old woman by the arm. "How dare you steal my smells!" he shouted. "You're nothing but a smell thief!" He wiped his hands on an apron
column11: then pulled it off and threw it back into the bakery.
